newsitem.title: USA: Dayton to take $0.35/shr Q4 charge.
newsitem.headline: Dayton to take $0.35/shr Q4 charge.

text.p: Dayton Hudson Corp said Friday it will take a one-time pretax charge against fourth quarter 1996 earnings of $134 million, or $0.35 a share, for the writedown of real estate and store closing costs.

Dayton said it is undertaking a real estate repositioning plan, which includes its Mervyn's division exiting from the Florida and Georgia markets. It also will sell or close about 10 Mervyn's stores in various other markets.
Dayton said it also plans to renovate its Marshall Field's downtown Milwaukee store.
The charge also includes the effect of the previously announced Marshall Field's dispositions in Texas and the closure of the Marshall Field's Park Forest, Ill., store.
As a result of this series of real estate transactions, Dayton said it expects to generate about $350 million in cash, which will be used to reduce debt and enhance its growth opportunities.
The new impact of these actions at Mervyn's will be to reduce annual revenue by about $375 million, based on 1996 performance.

As previously disclosed, the Marshall Field's dispositions in Texas and the closing of the Marshall Field's Park Forest store will reduce annual revenue by about $130 million. Marshall Field's is part of Dayton's Department Store Division. Mervyn's is a stand-alone division.
In the future, interest savings are expected to substantially offset the impact of these actions on operating profit at both Mervyn's and the Department Store Division.
